docs.lead_paragraph: It is hard to see Republican objections to a trade agreement as anything but partisan.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a series of 6-0 votes, an advisory committee to the F.D.A. endorsed the agency’s proposal to revoke the approval of the drug for use against advanced breast cancer.

headline.seo: A Cancer Drug, Avastin, May Lose F.D.A. Approval
headline.main: Panel Advises F.D.A. to Narrow Its Approval for Avastin
headline.print_headline: Panel Advises F.D.A. to Narrow Its Approval for Avastin

docs.snippet: In a series of 6-0 votes, an advisory committee to the F.D.A. endorsed the agency’s proposal to revoke the approval of the drug for use against advanced breast cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: The ruling, the first by a federal appeals court on the health care overhaul, affirmed a Michigan ruling that Congress can require that Americans obtain health insurance.

headline.seo: Obama Health Care Law Gets Support in First Appellate Review
headline.main: Round 1 in Appeals of Health Care Overhaul Goes to Obama
headline.print_headline: Round 1 in Appeals of Health Care Overhaul Goes to Obama

docs.abstract: Obama administration prevails in the first appellate review of the 2010 health care law as a three-judge panel from the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit holds that it is constitutional for Congress to require that Americans buy health insurance.
docs.snippet: The ruling, the first by a federal appeals court on the health care overhaul, affirmed a Michigan ruling that Congress can require that Americans obtain health insurance.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Parliament voted in an austerity plan that foreign lenders required before Greece could receive additional funds.

headline.main: Greece Approves Tough Measures on Economy
headline.sub: Vote Staves Off Risk of Default; Streets Fill With Protesters
headline.print_headline: Greece Approves Tough Measures on Economy

docs.snippet: Parliament voted in an austerity plan that foreign lenders required before Greece could receive additional funds.

byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens, and Liz Alderman from Paris.

docs.lead_paragraph: I cannot be the first person to walk out of Southampton Town Hall and long for a psychiatrist. The place is polite bedlam. Citizens shuffle down the halls muttering to themselves, aflush with high anxiety and low self-esteem, fists full of blueprints they cannot read and will have to change to something else they cannot read.

headline.main: You Really Can’t Fight Town Hall

docs.abstract: How many permits does it take to reopen a restaurant in the Hamptons after a small fire?
docs.snippet: How many permits does it take to reopen a restaurant in the Hamptons after a small fire?

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 2:04 p.m. | Kenneth Moreno and Franklin L. Mata dodged a bullet for a while longer.
docs.abstract: The Day: The issue of a “just sentence” is a thread running through several otherwise unrelated cases this week. Also, what City Room is reading in other papers and blogs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government shelved plans for a survey in which “mystery shoppers” would have seen how difficult it was to get appointments.
